text: The Sebacinales are an order of fungi in the class Agaricomycetes. Taxa have a widespread distribution and are mostly terrestrial, many forming mycorrhizas with a wide variety of plants, including orchids. The order is monotypic, containing a single family, the Sebacinaceae. There are 8-11 genera and 29-93 species in the family. ==Species== ==References== Category:Agaricomycetes Category:Fungus orders Category:Monotypic fungus taxa
title: Sebacinales
